page.title: 09LASHAM VILLAGE
page.content: In{Lasham village}there is a {Victorian church}called{St.Marys. It belongs to the{Church of England. There has been a church of some kind there since the{Saxon}times. Opposite the church there is a house called,{Post Office Cottage.} It is called Post Office Cottage because that is what it used to be. Half of the house was built in the {sixteenth century}and the other half is a little more modern. Down the road there is a farm. In the land owned by the farm there are many{blast trenches ( airraid {shelters ). On the other side of Lasham there is the{Depot.}It is used for storing goods before they are sold to shops. By the church there is a{public {house}called{The Royal Oak.
